summary: Funny things is I was new to got and wanted to read asoaif but the show ending and popular theory really diminish my interest to...
question: Funny things is I was new to got and wanted to read asoaif but the show ending and popular theory really diminish my interest to read the book not just Dany ( Bran/ king, the feels that everything kinda is the same and will go on) but not sure I like the "hero"Stark sound and find Dany arc (zigzag) weird she is bad when her usefulness date expire but is ok to fight ennemy with but at the end worse than Euron( he wants to be a god) or the others. guess Faegon who will not help(Cersei) better.
answer:
The thing about the show’s ending is that it massively distorts the thematics of the entire saga. And now it seems like they are trying to double down on it and make it work. But it doesn’t. What I think D&D may have done, is been influenced to some extent by certain anti theories and thought that they could follow them instead when they were making their massive revisions to the story line. Perhaps they thought that a fan theory must already have been checked and verified for any issues of canon consistency etc. and that they could avoid doing the hard work.

There is no redeeming Dany’s season 8 arc, of course. All arguments to the conclusion that it made any sense in terms of preceding seasons are rubbish. D&D have found themselves resorting to referring to speeches in season 2 or reactions in season 1. As if we never saw an immense amount of character development between then and now. As if we didn’t even see her saying contrary things about helping and defending innocents back then. As if her subsequent actions were not far more consistent with the compassionate Dany instead of the mad Dany they tried to shoehorn in at the end.

And yes, Dany does end up being used as an instrument to give the Starks a happy ending. First she occupies Dragonstone and thereby makes it possible for the North to get Dragonglass (you think Jon would have been able to get it from an island so close to King’s Landing if Dany were not the one occupying it? No, Cersei would have blocked him). Her forces and dragons provide major assistance to give humanity, but the Starks first, a plausible force against the Night King. Then she is the one who mops up the long standing Southern threat of Cersei and the Lannisters (i.e. the one that the North had never been strong enough to defeat). Then she conveniently dies after having destroyed King’s Landing as well as the Targaryen reputation and claim. So fully in fact that no one even thinks of whether Jon should have any claim either. And the North never has to lose its independence in any sense since she dies without successor or heir. After which her Unsullied and Dothraki simply leave. As does her dragon. So she came in, solved all the problems faced by the Starks, and they had to pay hardly any price at all other than Sansa being aggravated by their momentary surrender of independence.

I should point out though, that although it is far clearer in Dany’s case, but in fact Jon ends up being a tool to get the Starks here as well. The last two Targaryens clear away all their problems. Jon is used to bring in a Wildling army to win them back Winterfell, then get all the important stuff from Dany and bring her North, and finally eliminate Dany. After which he gets nothing from them either but has to end up at a place which is basically intended as a prison colony. House Stark has to give nothing up for all these benefits except a year or so of being under Targaryen rule (if we combine both Jon and Dany). 

And the great love story of Jonerys (as it was turning out to be before they crapped all over it) gets ruined and thrown under the bus for the Starks as well. Jonerys protects them from any strong action from Dany when Sansa acts towards her in a rude way. It makes Dany desirous of getting accepted by the family and makes her stay her hand in taking any vengeance against them even when she thinks Sansa is betraying her. 

Even for House Stark the thematics make no sense. The message seems to be that you should wait for an unexpected outside agent to come in and solve all your problems. I know the Stark stans are trying to say that the message is that you need to be honorable, but know how to play “the game” as well. However, that message, if intended, is not what is delivered by the show. “The game” is basically opposed to what is called “honorable” in what we were shown. I see these as absolutely contradictory. It is impossible to be both. All that is possible is to have some balance between where one follows one or the other on a case by case basis. But what is that balance and where does it lie? How is getting such a balance that different from the Lannister position? Even Tywin did not go about doing dishonorable stuff for no reason. He served Aerys quite loyally for many years, for instance. It was just that selfish House interests would trump honor when the two conflicted. But this does not seem too different from Sansa and Arya as we saw them at the end of season 8 (with some xenophobia thrown in the mix as well). The Starks in earlier seasons had a higher claim to being ‘honorable’. But they have changed and apparently discarded the aspects of their characters that made them honorable. Unless we are simply to accept that the Starks are honorable by definition due to the inertia of the earlier seasons, I do not see the show delivers any message about there being a need for both honor and  playing “the game.” But all that would mean is that if you want to play the game later in life then you should be very honorable in the early years of your life and then become a cynic later on. As to why you should still continue to be considered honorable after you’ve changed? I have no idea.

tags: dany deserved to be a momma
summary:
Here’s the thing about all the infertility/baby talk last season - it was completely fucking unnecessary. 
Seriously. 
Jon and...
body:
Here’s the thing about all the infertility/baby talk last season - it was completely fucking unnecessary.

Seriously.

Jon and Dany could have had a nice romantically tense moment in the Dragonpit without her mentioning she can’t have children and Jon calling that into question.

Dany and Tyrion could have argued about something else other than her “heir” in the war room.

Jorah could have said some other kind sentiment to Jon when telling him to keep Longclaw other than suggesting Jon pass it on to his children.

None of this was necessary. It didn’t add anything to the Jon/Dany romance. It’s not as if Jon said he couldn’t be with Dany without the hope of having kids or anything. It was totally superfluous to the love story being created. And of course, in the end, it amounted to nothing anyway.

Either D&D are just total idiots and didn’t know mentioning children so many times would have over half the audience thinking it meant Jon and Dany would eventually have kids. Or they did it on purpose to mislead people, further blurring the half-assed line between “foreshadowing” and “misdirection” or as I like to call it “retcon because we pulled this out of our asses.”

UGH this still makes me so mad!!!

summary: Everything Old is New Again - Kimmeridge - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Everything Old is New Again - Kimmeridge - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
This is a beautiful resurrection story. Just some quotes for you …

“If you don’t put faith behind it and fight for your beloved when their very life is on the line, then your love is just as empty as the howling wind.”

“My death has freed me. They’re still living in the same shackles they’ve always been in.”

“I won’t be alone, I’ll be left with more than enough dragons to cause any man to shit himself, as they say,” she tells him with a small smile, “and the people here bear no ill will toward me.”

summary: Guys when we complain about s8, especially the misogyny and racism in it, we really need to start saying HBO instead of D&D. D&D...
body:
Guys when we complain about s8, especially the misogyny and racism in it, we really need to start saying HBO instead of D&D. D&D already got Star Wars and they don’t give a shit about our complaint. Link hbo to the misogyny and racism. HBO does have an image to protect.

So say, HBO ruined the most iconic female character of the decade for mangst. HBO perpetuated the Mad Queen stereo type. HBO used pocs a cannon fodder and stepping stones.

body:
Burning ember ch.6

A/N- I hope you guys liked this chapter! Can’t wait to write more! :)

Warning- none really just incest.

Episode- 1x10

Pairing- Aegon x Targaryen!reader

Tagged- @starkbelova a , @kaleidoscope-holds-the-prophecy, @omgsuperstarg , @netuno-graphics

(Let me know if you want to be tagged)

—

“Aegon what are we still doing here? hmm most of the khalasar left and Drogo is not himself no more. He’s dead. which means that we have no more Dothraki army. So tell me brother what exactly are we doing here?” You ask Aegon as you sit on the edge of the bed in your tent. It had been a while since Daenerys had given birth. Her baby had been born dead and she still had yet to wake up. And Drogo was,well you didn’t really know what he was. His eyes were open but he looked dead. Whatever Daenerys had asked for it didn’t work or atleast not like how she wanted it to be.

“I’ve told you already y/n trust me we still need them. We have to stay here.” He said with a sigh.

“I’ve been waiting and nothing has happened. We should go back home and start from there.” You told him and he sat next to you. He nodded his head in disagreement.

“No we’ll stay here. Please just trust me okay?” He asked as he turned to look at you. You thought about it. It had seemed that there was no reason for you to be here but he kept telling you that you both needed to stay. And you trust your brother more than anyone. But there’s nothing for you here not anymore. But if he kept insisting then there might be a bigger reason.

“Alright.” You finally said and placed his hand on yours and thanked you with a gentle peck on the side of your head. You heard to what seemed to be Daenerys and Ser Jorahs voice. Aegon and you looked at one another and then walked out. And there she was walking. She looked weaker and there was sadness in her eyes. She was walking In hurry for someone who’s been out for a while. You couldn’t lie that the sight of her alive did get you quite mad you wanted her dead but she also didn’t seem like threat no more. She didn’t have a khalasar or her heir. Drogo was most likely dead. So she wasn’t a big threat no more. Or atleast you hope she wasn’t.

When Daenerys saw you and Aegon walk out a small smile appeared on her face.

“You two stayed?” She asked.

“Yes you’re family we couldn’t leave you not now.” Aegon answered and her smile grew bigger but it didn’t meet her eyes. Her smile died down quickly as she kept walking to where Drogo was. And her smile was replaced with the same frown from before. Once she saw Drogo laying on the floor she ran and kneeled beside him. She murmured something to him and then turned her head to face everyone behind her.

“Why is he out here alone?” Daenerys asked as she turned back to Drogo.

“He seems to like the warmth Princess.” Ser Jorah said. Or he could tell her the truth he’s dead and it was all because of the witch.

“He lives you asked for life you paid for life.” Maegi the witch told Daenerys.

“This is not life when will he be as he was?” Daenerys asked.

“When the sun rises in the west, sets in the east when the seas go dry, when the mountains blow in the wind like leaves.” Maegi said as you scoffed. Daenerys turned to glare at Maegi.

“We told you not to trust her…. we should kill her now for what she has done.” You told Daenerys. She looked up at you from she was. She stood quiet but you know she understood. She got up and started walking where you stood.

“Leave us.” Daenerys said and tried to make her way past you to go to Maegi. Ser Jorah stopped her before she went further.

“I don’t want you alone with the sorceress.” Jorah told her.

“He’s right she shouldn’t be alone with her not after what she has done.” Aegon spoke out.

“I have nothing more the fear from this women.” Daenerys told both men. “Go.” She ordered. Ser Jorah and Aegon hesitated but they left along with you.

-

(Aegon)

If was dark now. A lot has happened in such a short amount of time. People had died and the khalasar had left leaving them with no army. They were sent here to join Viserys and help him get the iron throne. He’s dead now. And now the army they were going to use were gone too. His sister was getting impatient now. He has given her no further explanation on why they needed to stay but so far he didn’t know either. That was until now. His dream was coming true. At first he was sure it wouldn’t come true and he wanted to leave but he couldn’t find himself willing to do so. It’s like he was being held down to stay. But now as he saw the same pyre from his dream then maybe it was the reason for his need to stay.

He saw the pyre being built and the rest of his dream came to mind. He could hear his mothers voice in his mind, calling to him. He could hear the chanting from his sister and he saw the eggs. If this was coming true then maybe he needed to follow his dream. He quickly went into his tent and got his egg. He held it and admired it. He looked around for cracks like it appeared in his dream but there was none. He made his way to his sisters tent and she was there reading something in her hand.

“Aegon.” She said to him and he gave her a half smile as he sat down his egg. She seemed to finally see the egg and looked at it and then him with confusion.

“What are you reading?” He asked her and she looked down to what seemed to be a letter.

“Just reading the letter from uncle Oberyn….. I miss him and the rest. I miss sunspear.” Her voice cracked with emotion. Her eyes were glossy. Seeing her like this wasn’t common. She didn’t really cry or showed to be upset. Then again there was no need to be that upset when they were in sunspear. She was happy there. She would smile more when she was in sunspear. She was different over there. But now they’re here and she has smiled yes but not as much as before. And she only seemed to be happy with him. So seeing her like this broke his heart a little. He walked over to her and gave her a tight embrace.

“Hey hey hey….. I know I miss them too but I promise you that we’ll see uncle Oberyn, Uncle Doran and the rest soon. I know being here right now doesn’t make since but it will.” He pulled away and he cupped her cheeks. He gave her a kiss on her forehead and stroked her cheek wiping the tears that rolled down them. “It will all make sense now.” He pulled apart from her and walked over to her egg. He tried to remember his dream as best as he could. He then went and got her dagger and went back to the chest with the egg in it.

“Come over here.” He said and she was hesitant not knowing what her brother was doing but she walked up behind him.

“Aegon what are you doing?” She asked him. And just like that he picked up the chest and wine to put it on the small table. “Aegon?” She asked catching his attention this time.

“You trust me right?” He asked with the dagger in his hand.

“I’ve told you only a thousand times that I do. But right now you’re beginning to question myself if I should.” She said the last comment as more of joke. But Aegon didn’t laugh and still seemed to be lost in his own thoughts.

“Okay I know this is going to sound crazy but I need you listen carefully okay?” He asked as he flipped the dagger so she could grab it.

“Uhmm okay?” She got the dagger from his hand and he turned to back the egg and back to her.

“You’re going to cut your palm and let the blood drop onto the egg. And while you’re doing that you’re going to be saying a chant in high Valeryian. Alright?” He explained to her but he was only met by a confused expression. She looked lost as he heard him explain.

“What? Why? What for?” She asked him and he then went around the room getting candles and placed them around the chest only making her more confused. “Aegon! What are you doing?!”

“I had a dream about the pyre and of fire surrounding it. I dreamed that someone was dead. And it came true. Drogo is dead and the pyre is being built. In my dream there was also these eggs and they were cracking.” He explained to her. She furrowed her eyebrows and seemed that she didn’t believe him. “I’ve had this dream multiple times now. Not only once. And it’s coming true that’s why I need you to do this. I saw you doing it my dream.” He told her.

“Uhh I- Aegon it was a dream.” She told him still not believing it.

“Yes but a dream that’s becoming true…. this is why we needed to stay this is why I asked you to stay and now I need you to trust me to do this.” He pleaded to her. She was quiet for a long time thinking of what to do. “Please.” He saw her swallow thickly and then she nodded.

“But if I die from this cut then I’ll haunt you forever.” He chuckled at her comment. After she has accepted he told her what to say. She cut her palm and let the blood drop onto the her egg while she said the words in high Valyrian just like in his dream.

After she had finished he wrapped up her cut and they both headed out with both of their dragon eggs in hand. Daenerys and what was rest of the khalasar were already out there. Y/N went to place her dragon egg in the pyre. Aegon thought Daenerys was going to stop them but she didn’t instead she offered them a smile. It’s like she understood what they were doing.

“What are you doing? You’ll need those dragon eggs. Don’t do the same as Daenerys and keep them.” Ser Jorah told them both.

“We will.” Aegon told him. Daenerys extended her hands out to Aegon and Y/N telling them to go stand by her and hold them. They were both a little suprised on why she was doing this but they took her hands.

“You will be our khalasar. I see the faces of slaves. I free you took off your collars go if you wish no one will stop you but if you stay it will be as brothers and sisters as husband and wives.” Daenerys announced. She paused and saw some people leave but she continued on. “Ser Jorah bind this women to the pyre.” He hesitated and she noticed. “ you swore to obey me.” After she told him that he did what he was told and tied up Maegi.

“We are the Targaryens of the blood of old Valyria! We are the last dragons and we swear to you that those who will harm you will die screaming.” Daenerys continued saying.

“You will not hear me scream!” Maegi said from where she was tied up.

“You will. They all do.” Y/N said to her.

“It’s not your screams I want only your life.” Daenerys said. She let go of their hands and then lit the pyre. It lit up just like how Aegon saw in his dreams. It was really becoming true. Daenerys walked in the pyre. Aegon let go of his sisters hand and then held onto his dragon egg with both hands. He started to walk towards the fire. He felt like it was calling to him. Telling him to go in it. Before he could go in he was stopped.

“Aegon? What are you doing? You can’t go in there.” She told him confused.

“Trust me….Ser Jorah don’t let her walk in after me.” He instructed him before he continued walking. He could hear his sister call out to him but he didn’t stop. He continued walking. He thought that the fire would burn him but it didn’t. The fire didn’t burn him.

-

(Y/N)

You fought and fought to be let go but he wouldn’t. You wanted to go after Aegon but Ser Jorah didn’t let you.

“Please! Iet me be atleast by him.” You begged him.

“No I won’t let you see him burn.” Ser Jorah told her.

You felt the tears run down your cheeks. You didn’t know about this part of his dream. He never told you he was going to do this. It was a crazy idea and you let him do it. You should’ve stopped him. But you also felt like it was the right thing to do.

“Please….. I won’t go in I just want to be by him.” You said again. You wiped your tear and stood up straight. “I’m going to go over there and you won’t stop me.” You said to him your voice in a more serious tone. He hestiated but he then moved to the side. You then walked over and stood outside the pyre. You waited and waited. You didn’t know how long or when you had fallen asleep but you did. You woke up to Ser Jorah standing by you. He helped you up and you saw and smelt the smoke and the ash from the burnt pyre. You then hurried over to where you saw two figures sitting on the floor.

When you saw Aegon he was covered In ash and he was naked. You looked over at daenerys and she looked the same as he did. He lifted his head and you felt relieved that he was alive. But then your eyes went wide when you a little red and black creature go up to his shoulder. You then felt something climb up your leg and and onto your arm. Unlike like his this one was smaller and it was black and blue. You saw their horns and their wings and you couldn’t believe at first but when you heard their screech it was loud. And filled the morning air.

They hatched. Your dragons had hatched. You had Dragons.

.

.

.

.

.

“You two stayed?” She asked.

“Yes you’re family we couldn’t leave you not now.” Aegon answered and her smile grew bigger but it didn’t meet her eyes. Her smile died down quickly as she kept walking to where Drogo was. She murmured something to him and then turned her head to face everyone behind her.

“Why is he out here alone?” Daenerys asked as she turned back to Drogo.

“He seems to like the warmth Princess.” Ser Jorah said. Or he could tell her the truth he’s dead and it was all because of the witch.

“He lives you asked for life you paid for life.” Maegi the witch told Daenerys.

“This is not life when will he be as he was?” Daenerys asked.

“When the sun rises in the west, sets in the east when the seas go dry, when the mountains blow in the wind like leaves.” Maegi said as you scoffed. Daenerys turned to glare at Maegi.

“We told you not to trust her…. we should kill her now for what she has done.” You told Daenerys. She looked up at you from she was. She stood quiet but you know she understood. She got up and started walking where you stood.

“Leave us.” Daenerys said and tried to make her way past you to go to Maegi. Ser Jorah stopped her before she went further.

“I don’t want you alone with the sorceress.” Jorah told her.

“He’s right she shouldn’t be alone with her not after what she has done.” Aegon spoke out.

At first he was sure it wouldn’t come true and he wanted to leave but he couldn’t find himself willing to do so. It’s like he was being held down to stay. But now as he saw the same pyre from his dream then maybe it was the reason for his need to stay.

He saw the pyre being built and the rest of his dream came to mind. He could hear his mothers voice in his mind, calling to him. He could hear the chanting from his sister and he saw the eggs. If this was coming true then maybe he needed to follow his dream. He quickly went into his tent and got his egg. He held it and admired it. He looked around for cracks like it appeared in his dream but there was none. He made his way to his sisters tent and she was there reading something in her hand.

“Aegon.” She said to him and he gave her a half smile as he sat down his egg. She seemed to finally see the egg and looked at it and then him with confusion.

“What are you reading?” He asked her and she looked down to what seemed to be a letter.

“Just reading the letter from uncle Oberyn….. I miss him and the rest. I miss sunspear.” Her voice cracked with emotion. Her eyes were glossy. Seeing her like this wasn’t common. She didn’t really cry or showed to be upset. Then again there was no need to be that upset when they were in sunspear. She was happy there. She would smile more when she was in sunspear. She was different over there. But now they’re here and she has smiled yes but not as much as before. And she only seemed to be happy with him. So seeing her like this broke his heart a little. He walked over to her and gave her a tight embrace.

“Hey hey hey….. I know I miss them too but I promise you that we’ll see uncle Oberyn, Uncle Doran and the rest soon. I know being here right now doesn’t make since but it will.” He pulled away and he cupped her cheeks. He gave her a kiss on her forehead and stroked her cheek wiping the tears that rolled down them. “It will all make sense now.” He pulled apart from her and walked over to her egg. He tried to remember his dream as best as he could. He then went and got her dagger and went back to the chest with the egg in it.

“Come over here.” He said and she was hesitant not knowing what her brother was doing but she walked up behind him.

“Aegon what are you doing?” She asked him. And just like that he picked up the chest and wine to put it on the small table. “Aegon?” She asked catching his attention this time.

“You trust me right?” He asked with the dagger in his hand.

“I’ve told you only a thousand times that I do. But right now you’re beginning to question myself if I should.” She said the last comment as more of joke. But Aegon didn’t laugh and still seemed to be lost in his own thoughts.

“Okay I know this is going to sound crazy but I need you listen carefully okay?” He asked as he flipped the dagger so she could grab it.

“Uhmm okay?” She got the dagger from his hand and he turned to back the egg and back to her.

“You’re going to cut your palm and let the blood drop onto the egg. And while you’re doing that you’re going to be saying a chant in high Valeryian. Alright?” He explained to her but he was only met by a confused expression. She looked lost as he heard him explain.

“What? Why? What for?” She asked him and he then went around the room getting candles and placed them around the chest only making her more confused. “Aegon! What are you doing?!”

“I had a dream about the pyre and of fire surrounding it. I dreamed that someone was dead. And it came true. Drogo is dead and the pyre is being built. In my dream there was also these eggs and they were cracking.” He explained to her. She furrowed her eyebrows and seemed that she didn’t believe him. “I’ve had this dream multiple times now. Not only once. And it’s coming true that’s why I need you to do this. I saw you doing it my dream.” He told her.

“Uhh I- Aegon it was a dream.” She told him still not believing it.

“Yes but a dream that’s becoming true…. this is why we needed to stay this is why I asked you to stay and now I need you to trust me to do this.” He pleaded to her. She was quiet for a long time thinking of what to do. “Please.” He saw her swallow thickly and then she nodded.

“But if I die from this cut then I’ll haunt you forever.” He chuckled at her comment. After she has accepted he told her what to say. She cut her palm and let the blood drop onto the her egg while she said the words in high Valyrian just like in his dream.

After she had finished he wrapped up her cut and they both headed out with both of their dragon eggs in hand. Daenerys and what was rest of the khalasar were already out there. Y/N went to place her dragon egg in the pyre. Aegon thought Daenerys was going to stop them but she didn’t instead she offered them a smile. It’s like she understood what they were doing.

“What are you doing? You’ll need those dragon eggs. Don’t do the same as Daenerys and keep them.” Ser Jorah told them both.

“We will.” Aegon told him. Daenerys extended her hands out to Aegon and Y/N telling them to go stand by her and hold them. They were both a little suprised on why she was doing this but they took her hands.

“You will be our khalasar. I see the faces of slaves. I free you took off your collars go if you wish no one will stop you but if you stay it will be as brothers and sisters as husband and wives.” Daenerys announced. She paused and saw some people leave but she continued on. “Ser Jorah bind this women to the pyre.” He hesitated and she noticed. “ you swore to obey me.” After she told him that he did what he was told and tied up Maegi.

“We are the Targaryens of the blood of old Valyria! We are the last dragons and we swear to you that those who will harm you will die screaming.” Daenerys continued saying.

“You will not hear me scream!” Maegi said from where she was tied up.

“You will. They all do.” Y/N said to her.

“It’s not your screams I want only your life.” Daenerys said. She let go of their hands and then lit the pyre. It lit up just like how Aegon saw in his dreams. It was really becoming true. Daenerys walked in the pyre. Aegon let go of his sisters hand and then held onto his dragon egg with both hands. He started to walk towards the fire. He felt like it was calling to him. Telling him to go in it. Before he could go in he was stopped.

“Aegon? What are you doing? You can’t go in there.” She told him confused.

“Trust me….Ser Jorah don’t let her walk in after me.” He instructed him before he continued walking. He could hear his sister call out to him but he didn’t stop. He continued walking. He thought that the fire would burn him but it didn’t. The fire didn’t burn him.

“Please….. I won’t go in I just want to be by him.” You said again. You wiped your tear and stood up straight. “I’m going to go over there and you won’t stop me.” You said to him your voice in a more serious tone. He hestiated but he then moved to the side. You then walked over and stood outside the pyre. You waited and waited. You didn’t know how long or when you had fallen asleep but you did. You woke up to Ser Jorah standing by you. He helped you up and you saw and smelt the smoke and the ash from the burnt pyre. You then hurried over to where you saw two figures sitting on the floor.

When you saw Aegon he was covered In ash and he was naked. You looked over at daenerys and she looked the same as he did. He lifted his head and you felt relieved that he was alive. But then your eyes went wide when you a little red and black creature go up to his shoulder. You then felt something climb up your leg and and onto your arm. Unlike like his this one was smaller and it was black and blue. You saw their horns and their wings and you couldn’t believe at first but when you heard their screech it was loud. And filled the morning air.

They hatched. Your dragons had hatched. You had Dragons.

.

.

.

.

.

blog.name: women-of-sci-fi-and-fantasy
blog.title: Women of Science Fiction & Fantasy
blog.description:
This blog is dedicated to listing the Women of Science Fiction & Fantasy on the Television, the Cinema Screen and in Literature.
I have created this list, as Science Fiction and Fantasy has many fantastic male characters, but the roles that Women play have often seen them in supporting roles or as bit players in a larger story. 
I wanted to recognise all the amazing women who have been a part of the stories, movies and TV programmes that I have enjoyed over the years 
The images in this blog have been chosen to highlight the character, but on occasion, I have had to use photos of the actor.
